snippet: Over the New Year's weekend I took a breather from the theater that left me feeling blissfully reenergized.
abstract: Over the New Year's weekend I took a breather from the theater that left me feeling blissfully reenergized.
lead_paragraph: Covering theater is a far cry from being a war correspondent, heaven knows, but there are times during the busier passages of the season when the number of incoming shows feels like an overwhelming barrage of aesthetic artillery. (Insert joke about bombs exploding right and left here.) Simply keeping on top of all the fall openings can put you in a bunker mentality. Weeks can go by when I don't have a chance to attend any cultural events that I'm not directly covering, which is not an ideal way of maintaining the properly wide frame of reference that a critic considering any discipline should strive to attain.

headline.main: Theater Talkback: Finding Other Thrills in Dance, Song and Wide Receiving
